result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay the DNA surcharge and all applicable costs, surcharges and fees by 09-20-2019 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Credit for 135 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) and voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-FIVE (135) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-FIVE (135) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees BY 09-20-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs BY 09-20-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
Cathryn S.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DTC/DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF WARRANT.

Defendant was arrested on new charges in a different County.  State moved to REMAND the Defendant.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED AT THIS TIME.

DEFENDANT APPEARED IN THE AFTERNOON WITHOUT COUNSEL.  After examination,  Court finds that the Defendant FREELY and of his OWN will WAIVES his right to Counsel.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant. Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned to 11-04-2015 at 1:30pm.  sdg
Defendant is waiting his acceptance into another court.    Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The defendant previously posted $200.00.  Balance due is $4800.00.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court received a Justice Point Violation today.  The defendant had a flat tire on the way to court and had to call AAA for assistance.  The state requests an increase in bail.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, Supplemental No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kaitlyn Schaut.

Defendant Dustin Geraldo Perez in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner appearing by telephone.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court to address Justice Point Violation.  The Court admonished defendant and takes no action at this time.  The Court allowed defendant while on GPS to travel to Marshfield to visit his father who is ill.  The Court also ordered that the defendant be allowed to stop near Froedtert Hospital to pick up his mother's friend from Pieper Electric.  Defendant is allowed to make two stops each way (a total of four stops) on his trip to Marshfield traveling less than one mile off the freeway to get gas and or food.  Case remains calendared for scheduling conference on October 28, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
